histogram.name: Favicons.DefaultResponse
histogram.summary: Records whether for a requested favicon the default favicon is served. The favicon service is called when a favicon is requested such as through a navigation to chrome://favicon2.

histogram.name: Favicons.FallbackToHostSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether for a requested favicon that does not have an exact local match, whether the fallback to host behavior finds a valid match. The favicon service is called when a favicon is requested such as through a navigation to chrome://favicon2.

histogram.name: Favicons.IconSuccess.{IconSizes}
histogram.summary: Records whether for a given size the favicon service successfully returned a favicon or not. The favicon service is called when a favicon is requested through a navigation to chrome://favicon2. A request for "largest available size" doesn't cause an emit to this histogram. If a request indicates multiple sizes of favicons are appropriate, this histogram is emitted multiple times (even though only one favicon is returned).

histogram.name: Favicons.LargeIconService.DownloadedSize
histogram.summary: Records the size (concretely the width) in pixel of the favicon downloaded from Google favicon server (size 0 denotes that download has failed).

histogram.name: Favicons.LargeIconService.FallbackSize
histogram.summary: Records the size (concretely the width) in pixel of the favicon that is used to generate a fallback style in the case when large enough favicon is not available (size 0 denotes that no favicon is available at all).
